Parking_Notes: 1 off-street space per ADU, except none if ADU <1000 sf or within 0.5 mile of a major transit stop (LUC 20.20.120.C.5).
Alley_Access_Allowed: Yes (DADU may be at alley lot line)
Owner_Occupancy_Notes: No owner-occupancy requirement in current ADU standards (LUC 20.20.120).
Design_Standards_Notes: ADU must meet single-family/middle housing dimensional standards; DADU follows middle housing standards; see LUC 20.20.538 and 20.20.125.
Process_Type: Ministerial (building permit; ADU is a permitted accessory use)
Notes: Approx. 1 du/ac; 35k sf min lot; large-lot single-family.
ADU_Parking_Exempt_If_Transit: Yes (within 0.5 mile of major transit stop)
ADU_Conversion_Notes: Conversions of existing accessory structures (including guest cottages) allowed even if nonconforming to setbacks/lot coverage; up to 300 sf per ADU for parking/storage exempt from 1,200 sf cap.
ADU_Site_Limit_Notes: Up to 2 ADUs per lot; no new ADU on unit lots created under 20.45A/B; no ADU where a home occupation under 20.30N is established.
DADU_Setback_Notes: DADU subject to middle housing dimensional standards and may be built at the alley lot line.
Critical_Area_Notes: Critical Areas Overlay can modify density, setbacks, and coverage; lot coverage/impervious computed after subtracting critical areas; see LUC 20.25H.040 and 20.25H.045.
Greenscape_Notes: At least 50% of front yard setback area must be greenscape in LL-1–LDR-1; existing deficits not penalized but cannot be reduced without offset (Chart 20.20.010 note 40).

Parking_Notes: 1 additional off-street space required per ADU; no ADU parking required within 0.5 mile of major or frequent transit; City may waive parking when near transit and on-street parking capacity exists.
Owner_Occupancy_Notes: No owner-occupancy requirement for ADUs under state law and SMC 20.40.210.
Occupancy_Limit_Notes: Occupancy limited by building and fire code; not specified separately for ADUs.
Design_Standards_Notes: ADUs must meet Shoreline building, fire, and zoning codes; attached and detached units require proper fire separation and, where required, sprinklers.
Impact_Fees_Notes: Transportation, park, and fire impact fees apply to ADUs at reduced rates; frontage improvements are not required for ADU-only projects.
Affordability_Requirements: No direct affordability requirement for ADUs; see SMC 20.40.230 for bonuses.
Notes: NR1: minimum lot size 2,500 sf; base building height 35 ft (40 ft with pitched roof). Front setback 10 ft, side setback 5 ft, rear setback 5 ft. Maximum hardscape 50% for one unit and 75% for two or more units. ADUs up to 1,200 sf, attached or detached, with alley flexibility for 0 ft side/rear setbacks.
ADU_Conversion_Notes: Conversions of existing spaces or structures to ADUs are allowed if current building, fire, and zoning codes are met; interior conversions may exceed 1,200 sf if the home and ADU share a roof on different floors.
ADU_Site_Limit_Notes: Each lot may have up to two ADUs; ADUs count toward the maximum number of homes on the lot.
DADU_Setback_Notes: Detached ADUs follow NR zone setbacks, but side and rearyard setbacks may be reduced to 0 ft when abutting an alley.
Critical_Area_Notes: Critical area and overlay provisions in Title 20 may further limit ADU placement.
Greenscape_Notes: Hardscape limits apply; remaining area is subject to landscaping and tree standards.

Notes: NR3: minimum lot size 7,200 sf; base building height 23 ft (28 ft with pitched roof). Front setback 10 ft, side setback 5 ft, rear setback 10 ft. Maximum hardscape 50%. ADUs up to 1,200 sf, attached or detached, with alley flexibility for 0 ft side/rear setbacks.
ADU_Conversion_Notes: Conversions of existing spaces or structures to ADUs are allowed if current building, fire, and zoning codes are met; interior conversions may exceed 1,200 sf if the home and ADU share a roof on different floors.

Parking_Notes: Residential buildings under 1,200 sf require no off-street parking per Ordinance 4102-25; parking may still be required for other dwellings on site.
Owner_Occupancy_Notes: No owner occupancy required for ADUs per Everett ADU FAQ.
Design_Standards_Notes: ADUs must comply with EMC 19.06 and applicable overlay design standards.
Entry_Orientation_Notes: No specific ADU entrance orientation requirement.
ADU_Conversion_Notes: Internal, attached, and detached ADUs allowed.
ADU_Site_Limit_Notes: Up to two ADUs total allowed per lot.
DADU_Setback_Notes: Rear/side setbacks reduced on alley lots per EMC 19.06.020.
Critical_Area_Notes: Critical area rules apply per EMC 19.37.

DADU_Setback_Notes: Rear setback 5 ft (0 ft on alley lots); side setbacks may reduce on alley lots.
Critical_Area_Notes: Critical area rules apply per EMC 19.37.

Owner_Occupancy_Notes: No owner occupancy required for ADUs per Everett ADU FAQ.
Design_Standards_Notes: ADUs must comply with EMC 19.09 and LI-MU development standards.
Entry_Orientation_Notes: No specific ADU entrance orientation requirement.
ADU_Conversion_Allowed: Internal, attached, and detached ADUs allowed.
ADU_Conversion_Notes: Up to two ADUs total allowed per lot.
ADU_Site_Limit_Notes: Setback increases required where abutting residential zones.
DADU_Setback_Notes: Critical area rules apply per EMC 19.37.
Critical_Area_Notes: Landscaping per EMC 19.35.
